title: How to Prevent Easy Install of Virtual Machine in VMware Workstation

steps.title: Click on File → New Virtual Machine in VMware Workstation window.
steps.content: Click on File → New Virtual Machine in VMware Workstation window. You can create a new virtual machine by pressing Ctrl + N .

steps.title: Choose the your VM configuration from New Virtual Machine Wizard window and click on Next.
steps.content: Choose the your VM configuration from New Virtual Machine Wizard window and click on Next. This guide uses Typical configuration, but you can choose Custom and do your changes, then click Next.

steps.title: Choose the operating system installer disc drive or image file (.ISO) and then click on Next.
steps.content: Choose the operating system installer disc drive or image file (.ISO) and then click on Next. You can choose to install operating system later.

steps.title: Fill up all information like full name, username and password, then click Next.
steps.content: Fill up all information like full name, username and password , then click Next.

steps.title: Type your VM's name and choose the location, where you'll save your VM.
steps.content: Type your VM's name and choose the location, where you'll save your VM. Then click Next.

steps.title: Choose the disk space you want to give to your VM and its allocation method, then click Next.
steps.content: Choose the disk space you want to give to your VM and its allocation method, then click Next.

steps.title: Check your VM settings and be sure that "Power on this virtual machine after creation" checkbox is not selected.
steps.content: Check your VM settings and be sure that "Power on this virtual machine after creation" checkbox is not selected. Click on Finish button.

steps.title: Now you'll notice an extra CD/DVD(IDE) drive, which is using autoinst.iso file.
steps.content: Now you'll notice an extra CD/DVD(IDE) drive, which is using autoinst.iso file. Click it to open "Virtual Machine Settings.'

steps.title: Click on CD/DVD (IDE) device, which is using autoinst.iso file, then click on Remove button below.
steps.content: Click on CD/DVD (IDE) device, which is using autoinst.iso file, then click on Remove button below. Click OK.

steps.title: Power on your VM by clicking on "Power on this virtual machine" under Commands section of left side pane and do the manual installation of your new VM.
steps.content: Power on your VM by clicking on "Power on this virtual machine" under Commands section of left side pane and do the manual installation of your new VM.
